item.title: M&E Seek to Know Much of the Son of God
item.itunes:title: M&E Seek to Know Much of the Son of God
item.description:
How much do you know God? Hopefully, your answer was little, which is the beauty of sanctification. We know little of all he is, yet, he has revealed all that we need to know of him; and we continue to grow in the knowledge of God. We do not grow in acceptance of God as we know more of him, but it is a sweet gift. How do we learn more about God? What knowledge are we to be growing in? Let’s follow Spurgeon as he takes us along in to “seek to know much of the Son of God”

item.description: The grace which we have received is enough to save us. No other work is needed. It is also enough for us to continue in our salvation! How strange it is to be so focused and obsessed with the things of the world. Things that will drag us down and ensnare. How much greater is the one who saved us, and saved us fully? He knows our hearts and knows what is perfect and good. Focus on him, brothers and sisters. Let him grow in your mind and let all of the things of earth grow strangely dim

item.title: M&E Return, O Backsliding Children!
item.itunes:title: M&E Return, O Backsliding Children!

I hope you are blessed by today's reading as we are called to consecrate ourselves to the cause of Christ.

item.title: The Lost Sermons Series: You Shall Not Enter!
item.itunes:title: The Lost Sermons Series: You Shall Not Enter!
item.description:
There is a mystery in Christianity. How can sinful people stand before a holy God? World history has wrestled with this question in all of their religions. Works seem to be the answer most of the time. Try to appease your deity with enough good stuff that they have no choice but to overlook the bad stuff. Is this really the answer? Can mankind appease all their wrongs with enough good? In this continuation of the Lost Sermons, C.H. Spurgeon answers these questions in Necessity of Purity for an Entrance to Heaven.
